algorithm_technique: Sliding window of size 3 to check for alternating colors.
Direct iteration and checking of triplets with circular consideration.
problem_summary_simple: Count groups of three adjacent tiles with alternating colors in a circular arrangement.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a sliding window of size 3 or direct iteration with modulo arithmetic to check for alternating color patterns in a circular array.
key_insights: The circular nature of the array needs to be handled, typically using the modulo operator.
A sliding window of size 3 can efficiently check contiguous triplets.
The condition for an alternating group is `color[i] != color[i+1]` and `color[i+1] != color[i+2]`.
A more concise approach is to directly iterate through the array and check the condition for each possible starting point of a triplet.
The modulo operator is crucial for handling the wrap-around for the last two elements.
The condition `colors[i] != colors[(i+1)%n] != colors[(i+2)%n]` directly checks for alternating colors.
